members.year: B.A. 2014, Computer Science; M.S. 2018, Computer Science
members.bio: My aunt introduced me to the words robot and artificial intelligence when I was seven. Ever since then, I've dreamt of a comic book-inspired future with super-intelligent machines. When I came to Boston University, I really wanted to study AI, but the classes never aligned with my schedule. I graduated undergrad without every taking any class in AI. What I see in the Machine Intelligence Community is an opportunity for anyone to get into artificial intelligence, learn without the penalty of failure and without the stress of deadlines, meet like-minded people, and foster intellectual curiosity.
members.fun_fact: I've been practicing parkour since 2005 and created the website Parkour Theory.

members.bio: I'm interested in ML and the MIC for the dissemination of understanding intelligence, and for the emerging ability to solve problems that were previously unsolvable.

I've always been interested in science fiction (especially Isaac Asimov's works) and exploring human intelligence in general, and I'm excited to see where the future with machine learning and AI will take us!
members.fun_fact: In high school, I once played in a three man jazz combo at a local ice cream shop and earned $80 that night.

members.bio: I’m an computer science undergraduate from New York. I was introduced to machine learning a few years ago and I’m now primarily interested in natural language processing and computer vision.
Interested in ml because of potential possibilities. Want to be involved in the forefront of innovation.
members.fun_fact: Sucks at parkour, trying to learn basketball, get me bubble tea and ill love u for life <3

members.bio: As the only business student on the e-board, I come from a non-traditional background in the context of MIC. However, I foster a keen interest in the tech sector (currently quite ML-oriented), and believe to understand it to the fullest, one should immerse themselves in the technical side in addition to macro-trends.
members.fun_fact: I fence sabre, play ball, lift recreationally, and play piano.

members.bio: The reason why I am interested in AI is because I am interested in pushing the limit of what computer can do. More specifically, I wants to further push the capability of machine in Natural Language Processing.
I feel pretty lucky to live in this day and age at the beginning of one of the most important innovations in human history, and would certainly like to participate in it.
members.fun_fact: I once managed to stay awake for 40+ hours during the finals period (with help of 9 red bulls)

members.year: B.A. 2019, Computer Science and Fine Art
members.bio: My name is Tammy Qiu and I am a junior majoring in Graphic Design and Computer Science. I am interested in learning about Artificial Intelligence because I believe that simulating intelligence will help us better understand our own intelligence as well as consciousness.
members.fun_fact: In my free time, I love to paint, read and dance.

members.bio: I study AI because in my opinion it is the perfect catalyst to making the world a better place. Creating an MIC community is important in furthering the knowledge of machine learning as ideas grow and bounce between individuals.
members.fun_fact: My friends call me brown suga.

members.bio: I am interesting in using machine learning to solve data mining problems, and study theories behind machine learning.
members.fun_fact: Enjoy teaching machines to think like humans

members.bio: I am interested in artificial intelligence because I find it fascinating and how it is changing every prospective of human life.

members.year: B.A. Communications and Computer Science Minor 2019
members.bio: I'm a junior at Boston University studying advertising and computer science. I'm currently the President & Founder of Girls Who Code BU, Head of Student Innovation at BU Spark!, and Director for two record breaking all-female and non-binary hackathons. I'm passionate about science, technology, communications and travel. My dream job would combine my interests in science and technology and my passion for design and innovation with the goal of bettering communities around the world. I'm in MIC because I'm interested in learning how machine learning can be applied to the field of communications.
members.fun_fact: When I'm not working or taking classes, you can find me running on the esplanade, mining for Ethereum, or spending all my money at overpriced Boston coffee shops.

members.bio: I earned my B.S in Mathematics from Southeast University, and got M.S degree in Computer Science from Boston University. My research interests focus on deep learning, graphical models and statistical learning. Starting in 2017, I will work as a software engineer at Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard.
members.fun_fact: I like traveling and hope to travel all over the world.(30% finished) I also enjoy hiking, skiing, photography and flying drones.

advisors.bio: Advances in machine learning will have wide-ranging effects on the computational sciences and society at large, and in particular with regard to privacy and cybersecurity. Building interest and awareness on this topic is essential for both productive and responsible engagement with this re-emerging area of research.
